com.qoppa.pdf.annotations

Interface Redaction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotation, ShapeAnnotation

    public interface Redaction
extends ShapeAnnotation
    Interface representing a Redaction annotation in a PDF document.
    Author:
    Qoppa Software

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_CENTER
      Indicates center alignment for overlay text; used by setOverlayTextAlignment(int).
      static int OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_LEFT
      Indicates left alignment for overlay text; used by setOverlayTextAlignment(int).
      static int OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_RIGHT
      Indicates right alignment for overlay text; used by setOverlayTextAlignment(int).

    • Method Detail

      • getQuadList

        java.util.Vector<java.awt.geom.Point2D[]> getQuadList()
        Returns a list of the quadrilaterals that compose this annotation if any. Each item in the list is an array of 4 Point.Double objects that contains the 4 points needed for that quadrilateral. May return an empty list, in which case the annotation is defined by it's rectangular bounds.
        Returns:
        List of quadrilaterals.

      • setOverlayText

        void setOverlayText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text string specifying the overlay text that should be drawn over the redacted region.
        Parameters:
        text - The overlay text string.

      • getOverlayText

        java.lang.String getOverlayText()
        Returns the text string specifying the overlay text that should be drawn over the redacted region.
        Returns:
        The overlay text string.

      • setOverlayFont

        void setOverlayFont(java.lang.String fontName,
                  float fontSize)
                    throws PDFException
        Sets the name and point size of the overlay text Font.

        The supported fonts are Helvetica, Helvetica-Bold, Helvetica-Oblique, Helvetica-BoldOblique, Courier, Courier-Bold, Courier-Oblique, Courier-BoldOblique, Times-Roman, Times-Bold, Times-Italic, Times-BoldItalic.

        The default font is Helvetica. The default font size is 12. If the size is 0, then the text will be resized to fill the redacted region.

        Parameters:
        fontName - The font name.
        fontSize - The Font size.
        Throws:
        PDFException

      • getOverlayFontName

        java.lang.String getOverlayFontName()
        Returns the overlay text font name.
        Returns:
        The overlay text font name.

      • getOverlayFontSize

        float getOverlayFontSize()
        Returns the overlay text font size.
        Returns:
        The overlay text font size.

      • setOverlayTextColor

        void setOverlayTextColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the overlay text color. The default color is white.
        Parameters:
        color - The overlay text color.

      • getOverlayTextColor

        java.awt.Color getOverlayTextColor()
        Returns the overlay text color
        Returns:
        The overlay text color.

      • setOverlayTextAlignment

        void setOverlayTextAlignment(int alignment)
        Sets the overlay text alignment. The possible values are OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_LEFT, OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_CENTER, OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_RIGHT. The default alignment is OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_LEFT;
        Parameters:
        alignment - The overlay text alignment.

      • getOverlayTextAlignment

        int getOverlayTextAlignment()
        Returns the overlay text alignment. The possible values are OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_LEFT, OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_CENTER, OVERLAY_ALIGNMENT_RIGHT.
        Returns:
        The overlay text alignment.

      • setOverlayTextRepeats

        void setOverlayTextRepeats(boolean repeats)
        Sets the flag to determine if the overlay text should repeat. If true, then the text will be repeated to fill the redacted region. The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        repeats - The overlay text repeats flag.

      • isOverlayTextRepeats

        boolean isOverlayTextRepeats()
        Returns the flag to determine if the overlay text should repeat.
        Returns:
        The overlay text repeats flag.

      • getCreationDate

        java.util.Date getCreationDate()
        Returns the date and time when the annotation was created. Milliseconds are always zero since the PDF date format doesn't support milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The date and time when the annotation was created.

      • setFillColor

        void setFillColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the annotation's fill color.
        Parameters:
        c - The new color.

      • getFillColor

        java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Returns the annotation's fill color.
        Returns:
        The annotation's fill color.
